You're afraid of this decision, and you are trying to argue until fate takes it out of your hands. You're taking the cowardly way out. And worse… you're too cowardly to even admit you're taking the cowardly way out.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're right. But I can change.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: He could've gotten out.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: People are found sometimes, even in… collapsed—

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I think they're pulling a body out.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Coroner confirms it's him. Dental records match.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: House hired me when no one else would.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: He got me fired. He gave me the guts to get fired.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: He gave me the courage to quit.

utterance.speaker: Blythe
utterance.content: Gregory was — he was a good son.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: He was a trying boyfriend, but I… never stopped loving him.

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: He was my husband for real. I couldn't help but love him.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: He was my boss. And… my employee. And both times… I learned from him.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: He made me a better parent, whether he meant to or not.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: He was willing to kill me. And I'll always be grateful.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: He wasn't always easy to deal with.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: But somewhere in there… he knew how to love.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: He was my friend. The thing you have to… remember — the thing you can't forget is that Gregory House saved lives. He was a healer. And-and in the end…

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: House was an ass. He mocked anyone —patients, co-workers, his dwindling friends — anyone who didn't measure up to his insane ideals of integrity. He claimed to be on some heroic quest for truth, but the truth is, he was a bitter jerk who liked making people miserable. And he proved that by dying selfishly, numbed by narcotics, without a thought of anyone. A betrayal of everyone who cared about him.

utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You're destroying your entire life. You can't go back from this. You'll go to jail for years. You can never be a doctor again.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm dead, Wilson. How do you want to spend your last five months?

utterance.content: When the cancer starts getting really bad…
